meanings.definition: Annoying or bothersome, like a gnat.
meanings.sent1: The gnatty sound of the buzzing mosquito kept me awake all night.
meanings.sent2: The gnatty little fly kept landing on my food.
meanings.sent3: I felt like a gnatty fly buzzing around, unable to sit still.
meanings.sent4: Her constant nagging was like a gnatty presence that wouldn't go away.
meanings.sent5: The gnatty behavior of the child made everyone in the room irritated.

meanings.definition: Covered in or infested with gnats.
meanings.sent1: The picnic blanket was gnatty with all the tiny bugs crawling on it.
meanings.sent2: The old barn was gnatty, with swarms of gnats flying around inside.
meanings.sent3: The gnatty dog rolled around in the grass, attracting even more insects.
meanings.sent4: The gnatty field was a cloud of tiny wings and buzzing sounds.
meanings.sent5: The gnatty air was thick with the presence of the tiny flying insects.
